did.unittitle: Edward B. Watson collection of World War I and World War II illustrations and cartoons
did.abstract: This collection consists of color illustrations and black-and-white cartoons relating to air, land, and sea activities during World War I and World War II. The cartoons were collected by Edward B. Watson and were clipped from various New York City newspapers and magazines.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by type (illustration or cartoon) and the conflict represented in the images (WWI or WWII).

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Edward B. Watson lived at 934 Albemarle Road in Brooklyn. He graduated from Williams College in 1929. He was elected as a councilor of the Long Island Historical Society in 1954.
